item.title: Marex 称已反驳卖空报告中的所有指控
item.description: 经纪商 Marex Group Plc 驳斥了 Ningi Research 关于其财务报告质量的指控，并表示这些指控不会对其业务造成实质性影响。【原文：Broker Marex Group Plc refuted claims by Ningi Research about the quality of its financial reporting and said the allegations aren’t materially affecting its business.】

item.title: 加拿大 "准备好 "与中国就油菜籽争端进行贸易谈判
item.description: 加拿大贸易部长和农业部长表示，他们对中国决定对加拿大油菜籽征收新关税 "深感失望"，但随时准备与中国政府就贸易争端进行接触。【原文：Canada’s trade and agriculture ministers said they are “deeply disappointed” with China’s decision to impose new duties on Canadian canola, but stand ready to engage with Beijing on the trade dispute.】

item.title: 捷克防务公司 CSG 据称将为 2026 年的潜在 IPO 挑选银行
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，国防制造商捷克捷克斯洛伐克集团公司（Czechoslovak Group AS）已经选定了几家银行来主导其潜在的首次公开募股。【原文：Defense manufacturer Czechoslovak Group AS has selected banks to lead its potential initial public offering that could take place as soon as next year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国生物燃料制造商承诺为贝莱德持有的债务提供担保
item.description: 陷入困境的生物燃料生产商 Green Plains Inc. 已将其大部分乙醇工厂抵押给贝莱德公司管理的基金，以换取更多时间偿还近 1.28 亿美元的债务。【原文：Troubled biofuels maker Green Plains Inc. has pledged the bulk of its ethanol plants as collateral to funds managed by BlackRock Inc. in exchange for more time to repay nearly $128 million in debt.】

item.title: CPI数据支持鸽派，美联储缩表预期升温
item.description: 一份基本良好的美国通胀报告为下注美联储将很快降息的交易商提供了支持，一些交易商认为大幅降息的可能性增大。【原文：A largely benign US inflation report is bolstering the case for traders wagering that the Federal Reserve will soon cut interest rates, with some seeing an increased possibility of an outsize reduction.】

item.title: 美国股市延续创纪录涨势，风险偏好者继续反弹
item.description: 由于投资者对美联储降息的预期持续升温，风险情绪升温，周三美国股市向历史新高发起冲击。【原文：US stocks pushed toward fresh record highs on Wednesday as expectations for interest-rate cuts from the Federal Reserve continued to build among investors, increasing risk-on sentiment.】

item.title: 贝森特警告欧洲在俄罗斯问题上 "不闭嘴就闭嘴 "的时候到了
item.description: 财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）敦促欧洲国家做好准备，对中国和其他购买俄罗斯能源的国家征收更高的关税。【原文：Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent urged European nations to be prepared to get on board with higher tariffs on China and other nations that buy Russian energy, lamenting that he got a cool response when he floated the idea at a Group of Seven meeting earlier this year.】

item.title: 调查显示：美股反弹掩盖了交易员对关税的担忧
item.description: 最新的市场脉搏（Markets Pulse）调查显示，在推动标准普尔500指数（S&P 500）创下历史新高的乐观情绪背后，是对贸易保护主义将对美国资产造成持久损害的挥之不去的担忧。【原文：Beneath the optimism propelling the S&P 500 toward fresh record highs is lingering concern that trade protectionism will inflict lasting damage on US assets, according to the latest Markets Pulse survey.】

item.title: 亚马逊将在 3,300 个城市提供当日杂货配送服务
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）目前已在 1000 多个城市提供当日杂货配送服务，并计划在今年年底前将这一服务推广到 2300 多个城市，这标志着该公司在食品配送需求保持稳定的情况下进行了一次重大扩张。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. is now offering same-day grocery delivery in more than 1,000 cities and plans to bring the service to over 2,300 more by the end of the year, marking a major expansion as demand for food deliveries has remained resilient.】

item.title: 作为削减成本运动的 "第一步"，CPChem 裁员 130 人
item.description: Chevron Phillips Chemical Co. 是 Chevron Corp. 和 Phillips 66 各占一半股份的合资企业，在席卷德克萨斯州石油和化工行业的最新一轮裁员中，该公司已裁减了约 130 个工作岗位。【原文：Chevron Phillips Chemical Co., a 50-50 joint venture between Chevron Corp. and Phillips 66, has cut roughly 130 jobs in the latest in a round of reductions sweeping through the Texas oil and chemicals sector.】

item.title: 美国压榨政府，瑞士战斗机成本增加
item.description: 瑞士在购买洛克希德-马丁公司（Lockheed Martin Corp.在美国出人意料地对瑞士征收高额关税之后，瑞士政府又一次遭遇挫折。【原文：Switzerland faces additional costs of as much as 1.3 billion Swiss francs ($1.6 billion) to buy Lockheed Martin Corp. F-35A fighter jets after failing to push through a fixed-price deal, in another setback for the government after the US slapped surprisingly high tariffs on the country.】

item.title: 卡地纳健康启动高等级债券销售，为 Solaris 交易提供资金
item.description: 卡地纳健康公司（Cardinal Health Inc.【原文：Cardinal Health Inc. plans to sell bonds in the US investment-grade primary market on Wednesday to help fund its acquisition of Solaris Health.】

item.title: 智利决策者称 7 月降息四分之一是唯一选择
item.description: 根据周三公布的会议记录，智利央行在最近一次政策决定中表示，降息四分之一个点是 "唯一可行的选择"。【原文：Chile’s central bank said a quarter-point interest rate cut was the “only plausible option” at its most recent policy decision, according to the minutes to that meeting published on Wednesday.】

item.title: 巴西零售销售再次下滑，预示经济正在降温
item.description: 巴西 6 月份的零售额意外下降，这是连续第三次下降，也是拉丁美洲最大经济体正在降温的最新迹象。【原文：Brazil’s retail sales unexpectedly fell in June, marking their third consecutive drop and the latest sign Latin America’s biggest economy is cooling down.】

item.title: 巴西法院放宽电信公司 Oi 寻求破产保护的条件
item.description: 里约热内卢一家法院暂停执行 Oi SA 在巴西的司法恢复计划中规定的义务，为该公司可能在美国申请破产保护开辟了道路。【原文：A Rio de Janeiro court suspended the enforceability of obligations set out in Oi SA’s judicial recovery plan in Brazil, opening the way for the company to potentially seek a Chapter 11 filing in the US.】

item.title: 由匿名加密货币持有者决定的数百万 Polymarket 赌注
item.description: Polymarket是一个全球交易所，交易者可以在真实世界的事件结果上下注，从选举到埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）在X上发帖的频率，无所不包，Polymarket已成为硅谷和华尔街的热门话题。【原文：With a global exchange that lets traders bet on the outcome of real world events — everything from elections to how often Elon Musk posts on X — Polymarket has become the talk of both Silicon Valley and Wall Street.】

item.title: 比特币、以太币逼近历史新高，国债交易持续升温
item.description: 随着投资者纷纷涌入这两种最大的加密货币，比特币和以太币的交易价格都离历史高点仅有一线之隔，最近的一波需求浪潮更倾向于后者。【原文：Bitcoin and Ether are both trading within a whisker of all-time highs as investors pile into the two largest cryptocurrencies, with a recent wave of demand tilting in favor of the latter.】

item.title: 贝森特称美联储利率可能应下调 150 至 175 个基点
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）表示，利率 "过于严格"，可能应降低 150-175 个基点。【原文：US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said interest rates are “too constrictive” and should likely be 150-175 basis points lower.】

item.title: 私募股权投资的最新金融炼金术令投资者担忧
item.description: Revelstoke Capital Partners 第一次询问投资者是否可以比往常更长时间地持有 Fast Pace Health 公司时，投资者答应了。当时是2020年，一场全球大流行病让市场惶惶不可终日。【原文：The first time Revelstoke Capital Partners asked investors if it could hold on to Fast Pace Health for longer than usual, they obliged. It was 2020, and a global pandemic had markets on edge.】

item.title: 沙特财富基金管理资产跃升，回报率下滑
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯主权财富基金去年资产激增，巩固了其作为全球最大国家支持投资者之一的地位，尽管年化回报率有所下降。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund solidified its position as one of the world’s biggest state-backed investors as assets surged last year, though annualized returns dropped.】

item.title: 欧佩克+"重塑了石油市场的计算，催生了创纪录的供应过剩
item.description:
国际能源机构预测，到明年，每天的过剩量将接近 300 万桶。【原文：

The International Energy Agency forecasts a surplus approaching 3 million barrels a day by next year.

】

item.title: German Defense Contractor Mulls US Shift After Merz Israel Ban
item.description: 德国国防公司伦克集团（Renk Group AG）表示，它可能会将指定为以色列生产的产品转移到一家美国工厂，以回应弗里德里希-默茨总理停止向以色列交付某些武器的决定。【原文：German defense company Renk Group AG said it might relocate production designated for Israel to a US plant, responding to Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s decision to halt certain arms deliveries to the country.】

item.title: 对冲基金老板称出售 Orsted 股票是 "邀请 "做空
item.description: 丹麦 Orsted A/S 公司出售 90 多亿美元股票的计划被一家对冲基金的老板视为做空该公司股票的邀请。【原文：The plan by Denmark’s Orsted A/S to sell more than $9 billion of shares is being seen by one hedge fund boss as an invitation to short the stock.】

item.title: Ring 门铃是亚马逊最实用人工智能的展示平台
item.description: 欢迎收看 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日通讯。今天，奥斯汀-卡尔（Austin Carr）将为亚马逊的人工智能环形摄像头（AI-powered Ring cameras）出谋划策。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Austin Carr makes the case for Amazon’s AI-powered Ring cameras.】

item.title: 意大利寻求限制中国对重要公司的所有权
item.description: 在关税和强势欧元对意大利出口商构成挑战之际，意大利政府正在考虑限制中国投资者在关键公司持股的计划，以避免与美国关系紧张。【原文：Italy’s government is considering plans to curb Chinese investors’ holdings at key companies to avoid tensions with the US at a time when tariffs and a strong euro are challenging Italian exporters.】

item.title: 中国如何为与美国的贸易战做好准备
item.description: 我是马尔科姆-斯科特，驻悉尼的国际经济编辑。今天，汤姆-奥利克（Tom Orlik）将探讨中国为与美国进行贸易斗争所做的长期准备。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册接收本新闻通讯，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Malcolm Scott, international economics editor in Sydney. Today, Tom Orlik looks at China’s long preparation for its trade fight with the US. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 美国人以创纪录的速度被挤出房主行列
item.description:
越来越多的美国人被挤出了住房拥有者的行列。其长期影响可能会重塑社会。【原文：

More Americans are getting priced out of homeownership. The long-term implications could reshape society.

】

item.title: 美国 30 年期抵押贷款利率创 2 月以来最大降幅
item.description: 美国抵押贷款利率上周创下了自 2 月份以来的最大降幅，吸引了房主们加大重新融资的力度。【原文：US mortgage rates dropped last week by the most since February, enticing homeowners to step up refinancing.】

item.title: 俄罗斯将在 2025 年前分散减产石油以补偿欧佩克+组织
item.description: 俄罗斯计划将其需要进行的剩余减产分摊开来，作为对超出欧佩克+目标的补偿，从而将减产进程再延长三个月。【原文：Russia plans to spread out remaining output reductions it needs to make as compensation for exceeding its OPEC+ target, stretching the process by an additional three months.】

item.title: 什么关税？通胀数据点燃风险资产，谁在乎？
item.description: 在一份良性的美国通胀报告消除了人们对滞胀的担忧，并解除了美联储降息的障碍之后，全球投资者纷纷跳水，追捧风险最高的资产。【原文：Global investors dived in the riskiest assets after a benign US inflation report dispelled fears of stagflation and lifted a roadblock for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates.】
